member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.BinaryConversion
member.summary: Enumerates the possible binary conversion methods for legacy controls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.BinaryConversion.Decimal
member.summary: Each byte is converted into three characters. This option provides for the easiest conversion between binary and ASCII characters for Visual Basic and similar languages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.BinaryConversion.Nibble
member.summary: Each byte is converted into two characters. This option provides for the fastest conversion between binary and ASCII characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.BinaryConversion.None
member.summary: Data is placed one byte per character, with no conversion. This is the default.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.Biometrics.Identify(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.PointOfService.BiometricsInformationRecord},System.Int32)
member.summary: Captures biometrics data, compares it to an array of s, and then returns a rank ordered array of indexes.
member.param: The requested FAR criterion for successful verification.
A collection of properties against which the Identify match is performed.
The requested FRR criterion for successful verification.
Maximum number of milliseconds to try a successful biometric capture before failing.

If both criteria are provided, this parameter indicates which takes precedence. falseAcceptRatePrecedence indicates that maxFARRRequested takes precedence; falseRejectRatePrecedence indicates that maxFRRRequested takes precedence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.Biometrics.IdentifyMatch(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Microsoft.PointOfService.BiometricsInformationRecord,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.PointOfService.BiometricsInformationRecord})
member.summary: Compares a sample Biometrics Information Record against the entries of a collection of other Biometrics Information Records, and then returns a rank ordered array of indexes.
member.param: An array of properties against which the Identify match is performed.
The requested FAR criterion for successful verification.
The property to be identified.
The requested FRR criterion for successful verification.An EMPTY pointer indicates that this criterion is not provided.

If both criteria are provided, this parameter indicates which takes precedence. falseAcceptRatePrecedence indicates that maxFARRRequested takes precedence, falseRejectRatePrecedence indicates that maxFRRRequested takes precedence.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the BiometricsInformationRecord class.
member.param: The version of the BIR, which is defined by the service object.

The recorded biometrics data, in a format that is defined by the service object. Other information about the BIR such as a checksum or proprietary information may also be included in the biometric data.
Assigned by the format owner; optionally registered with the IBIA.
The purpose of the biometrics information.
FormatOwner values that are assigned and registered by the International Biometric Industry Association (IBIA).
The type of data contained in the BIR.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the class and initializes its members to the specified values.
member.param: Contains the value of the false accept rate achieved for the match. This value is an indicator of the closeness of match.
Contains the value of the false reject rate achieved for the match. This value is an indicator of the closeness of the match.
A pointer to handle the adapted BIR. If this parameter is left empty, an adapted BIR is not created.
A Boolean value that is true for a successful match or false for a failed match.
If a payload is associated with the referenceBIR, it is returned in an allocated byte[] if the FARAchieved satisfies the match criteria of the Service.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.CatLogs
member.summary: Enumerates the available log functions for a credit authorization terminal (CAT) device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CatLogs.None
member.summary: The CAT device does not have the daily log functions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CatLogs.Reporting
member.summary: The CAT device has only an intermediate total function that reads the daily log, but does not erase the log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CatLogs.ReportingAndSettlement
member.summary: The CAT device has the intermediate total function and the final total and erases daily log functions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CatLogs.Settlement
member.summary: The CAT device has only the final total and erases daily log functions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability
member.summary: Enumerates the possible default character sets for a printer, line display, or point card reader/writer device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability.Alpha
member.summary: The default character set supports uppercase alphabetic plus numeric data, space, minus, and period.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability.Ansi
member.summary: The default character set supports ANSI characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability.Ascii
member.summary: The default character set supports all ASCII characters between 20-hex and 7F-hex.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability.Kana
member.summary: The default character set supports partial code page 932. This includes ASCII characters 20-hex through 7F-hex and the Japanese kana characters A1-hex through DF-hex, but excluding the Japanese kanji characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability.Kanji
member.summary: The default character set supports code page 932, including the Shift-JIS kanji characters, Levels 1 and 2.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability.Numeric
member.summary: The default character set suports numeric data, plus space, minus, and period. (Line Display devices only.)

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability.Unicode
member.summary: The default character set supports UNICODE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.CharacterSetCapability.Windows
member.summary: The default character set supports ANSI characters.

member.summary: Indicates that the check scan is complete.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.BeginInsertion(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts the document insertion process.
member.param: Specifies the number of milliseconds before failing the method. If timeout is set to 0 (zero), the method tries to begin insertion mode, returns immediately if this is successful. Otherwise, an exception is thrown. If timeout is set to WaitForever, the method tries to begin insertion mode, waits as long as needed until either the check is inserted or an error occurs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.BeginRemoval(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts the document removal process.
member.param: Gives the number of milliseconds before failing the method. If timeout is set to 0 (zero), the method tries to begin removal mode, returns immediately if this is successful. Otherwise, it throws an exception. If timeout is set to WaitForever (-1), the method tries to begin removal mode, waits as long as needed until either the check is removed or an error occurs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.ClearImage(Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckImageClear)
member.summary: Clears a specific image or all the images in the device memory.
member.param: Indicates how the image file is to be located so that it can be removed from the device storage. Possible values are defined by the enumerator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.ClearInput
member.summary: Clears all device input that has been buffered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.ClearInputProperties
member.summary: Resets the values of properties altered by or .

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.DefineCropArea(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Establishes one or more cropping areas that can be applied to a scanned image.
member.param: The numeric identifier for the defined crop area.
The value added to the X-coordinate to determine the x endpoint for the cropping area. If set to , the x endpoint value is set to the value of the property.
The value added to the Y-coordinate to determine the y endpoint for the cropping area. If set to , the y endpoint value is set to the value of the property.
The starting X-coordinate of the cropping area.
The starting Y-coordinate of the cropping area.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.EndInsertion
member.summary: Ends the document insertion process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.EndRemoval
member.summary: Ends the document removal or ejection mode.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.RetrieveImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the most recently scanned image that resides in the available memory and uses it to populate the property.
member.param: Specifies the numeric identifier for the storage location of the crop area definition to be applied to the most recently scanned image held in the working area memory of the device. If cropAreaID is set to , the area of the most recently scanned image is retrieved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.RetrieveMemory(Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckImageLocate)
member.summary: Retrieves an image that was stored in memory and uses it to set the property.
member.param: Indicates how the image file is to be located so that it can be retrieved from the device memory storage. Possible values are defined by the enumeration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.CheckScanner.StoreImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stores an image or a cropped area of the image in the memory of the device.
member.param: Specifies the numeric identifier for the storage location of the crop area definition to be applied to the image data file that is currently in the buffer memory area of the check scanner device. If cropAreaID is set to then an exact image of the buffer memory is stored in the device memory (no cropping applied).

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.ElectronicJournal.RetrieveCurrentMarker(Microsoft.PointOfService.MarkerType)
member.summary: Returns the last implicitly stored marker.
member.param: The marker for the end of a session is returned.
The first implicitly stored marker on the medium is returned.
The marker for the beginning of a session is returned.
The marker for the document or ticket is returned.
Specifies the type of the queried current marker. See values in Remarks.
The last implicitly stored marker on the medium is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.ElectronicJournal.RetrieveMarker(Microsoft.PointOfService.MarkerType,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a marker implicitly stored on the record medium.
member.param: Contains the number of the queried markers document. If the value of markerType is SessionBegin or SessionEnd, this parameter is ignored.
The marker for the end of a session is returned.
The marker for the beginning of a session is returned.
Contains the session number of the queried marker. If a session concept is not supported by the device, this parameter must be set to a value that is less than zero.
The marker for the document or ticket is returned.
Specifies the type of the queried current marker. See values in Remarks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.ElectronicJournal.RetrieveMarkerByDateTime(Microsoft.PointOfService.MarkerType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a marker implicitly stored on the record medium.
member.param: The marker for the document or ticket is returned.

If more than one marker of the requested type exists during the time period specified by the dateTime parameter, this parameter specifies the number of the marker which will be queried. Numbering for markers begins at 1 and is continuously incremented by one for each marker.
The marker for the beginning of a session is returned.
The marker for the end of a session is returned.
The date/time period the marker is queried for. The format of dateTime is 'YYYYMMDDhhmmss'. If the application cannot specify the hours, minutes, and seconds, then these fields can be omitted.
Specifies the type of the queried current marker.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.ElectronicJournal.RetrieveMarkersDateTime(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the date/time of the given marker.
member.param: Specifies the marker from which the date/time will be retrieved.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode
member.summary: Enumerates the valid types of errors for an error event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Busy
member.summary: The current state does not allow this request. For example: if asynchronous output is in progress, certain methods may not be allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Claimed
member.summary: The device is opened but not claimed. Another application has the device claimed, so it cannot be claimed at this time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Closed
member.summary: The device must be opened.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Deprecated
member.summary: The method has been deprecated and is no longer available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Disabled
member.summary: The device is opened and claimed (if this is an exclusive use device), but not enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Exists
member.summary: The file name (or other specified value) already exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Extended
member.summary: A device category-specific error condition occurred. The error condition code is held in the exception's property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Failure
member.summary: The device cannot perform the requested procedure, even though the physical device is connected to the system, powered on, and on-line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Illegal
member.summary: An attempt was made to perform an illegal or unsupported operation with the device, or an invalid parameter value was used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.NoExist
member.summary: The file name (or other specified value) does not exist.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.NoHardware
member.summary: The physical device is not connected to the system or is not powered on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.NoService
member.summary: The control cannot communicate with the service object, normally because of a setup or configuration error.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.NotClaimed
member.summary: The device is opened but not claimed. No other application has the device claimed, so it can and must be claimed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Offline
member.summary: The physical device is off-line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Success
member.summary: No error occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorCode.Timeout
member.summary: The service object timed out waiting for a response from the physical device, or the control timed out waiting for a response from the service object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorLocus
member.summary: Enumerates possible times when an error occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorLocus.Input
member.summary: Error occurred while gathering or processing event-driven input. No input data is available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorLocus.InputData
member.summary: An error occurred while gathering or processing event-driven input, and some previously buffered data is available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorLocus.Output
member.summary: An error occurred while processing asynchronous output.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorResponse
member.summary: Enumerates the valid responses an application can make to an error event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorResponse.Clear
member.summary: Clear the buffered events and events and exit the error state, changing State to Idle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorResponse.ContinueInput
member.summary: This response acknowledges the error and directs the device to continue processing. The device remains in the error state, and delivers additional data events as directed by the property. When all input has been delivered and the property is again set to TRUE, another is delivered with locus Input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ErrorResponse.Retry
member.summary: This response directs the device to retry the input. The error state is exited, and State is changed to Idle.

member.summary: The printer is processing fixed text output to one or more stations. In this state, the printer accepts either the or method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.FiscalPrinterState.ItemList
member.summary: The printer is processing an item list report. In this state, the printer accepts either the or method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.FiscalPrinterState.Locked
member.summary: The printer has encountered a non-recoverable hardware problem. An authorized printer technician must be contacted to exit this state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.FiscalPrinterState.Monitor
member.summary: If the property is false, the printer is not in a specific operational mode. In this state, the printer accepts any of the methods and the methods.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.FiscalPrinterState.NonFiscal
member.summary: The printer is processing nonfiscal output to one or more stations. In this state, the printer accepts either the or method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.FiscalPrinterState.Report
member.summary: The printer is processing a fiscal report. In this state, the printer does not accept any methods until the report has been completed.

The length of the file in bytes. When it is created, the file size cannot be changed: totals files are fixed-length files.

The level of error detection desired for this file:If true, the service object enables advanced error detection if supported.If false, better performance access is required so that advanced error detection do not have to be enabled for this file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageMode
member.summary: Enumerates the possible modes of operation that an Image Scanner device can use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageMode.All
member.summary: The image scanner transmits video streams, and it tries to read bar code data. When a bar code is read, the bar code data and a still image are transmitted. The image resolution of video data could be different from the resolution of still image data. A hydra implementation of Image Scanner and Scanner is required for this mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageMode.DecodeOnly
member.summary: The image scanner does not transmit still images or video to the application. However, it transmits bar code data decoded from purchased images through a Scanner service. A hydra implementation of Image Scanner and Scanner is required for this mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageMode.StillAndDecode
member.summary: The image scanner transmits still images, and it tries to read bar code data. However, it does not transmit video streams. A hydra implementation of and Scanner is required for this mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageMode.StillOnly
member.summary: The image scanner transmits still images. However, it does not try to read bar code data, nor does it transmit video.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageMode.VideoAndDecode
member.summary: The image scanner transmits video streams, and it tries to read bar code data. A hydra implementation of Image Scanner and Scanner is required for this mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageMode.VideoAndStill
member.summary: The image scanner transmits video streams, and it transmits still images. However, it does not try to read bar code data. The image resolution of video data could be different from the resolution of still image data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageQuality
member.summary: Enumerates the level of image quality supported by the Image Scanner device.

member.summary: High image quality is supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageQuality.Low
member.summary: Only low image quality is supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ImageQuality.Medium
member.summary: Medium image quality is supported.

member.summary: Ready to dispense items from all slots. This value is also set when the dispenser is unable to detect error conditions.

member.summary: Cannot dispense items, because a mechanical fault has occurred.

member.summary: Can still dispense items. However, the dispenser is almost empty. If is greater than one (1), some slots are almost empty.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.ItemDispenserStatus.Ok
member.summary: Ready to dispense items from all slots. This value is also set when the dispenser is unable to detect error conditions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.Keylock.WaitForKeylockChange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Used by the application to wait for a specified keylock position to be set.
member.param: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait for the keylock before returning control back to the application.If zero, returns the appropriate status immediately.If WaitForever, waits as long as needed until the requested key position is satisfied or an error occurs.

Requested keylock position.keyPosition can contain one of the following values:ValueMeaningWait for any keylock position change.Wait for keylock position to be set to the “locked” position.Wait for keylock position to be set to the “normal” position.Wait for keylock position to be set to the “electronic” position.Wait for keylock position to be set to the “supervisor” position.Other ValuesWait for keylock position to be set to one of the auxiliary positions. This value may range from four (4) up to the total number of keylock positions indicated by the property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.Micr.BeginInsertion(System.Int32)

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.Micr.BeginRemoval(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts the check removal processing.
member.param: The timeout parameter gives the number of milliseconds before failing the method.If timeout is zero, tries to begin Removal mode, then returns the appropriate status immediately.If timeout is WaitForever, tries to begin Removal mode, then waits until either the check is removed or an error occurs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.PosPrinter.PrintTwoNormal(Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterStation,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Prints two strings on two print stations concurrently. When supported, this may give increased print performance.
member.param: The printer stations to be used. Possible values are defined by the enumeration. Valid values are as follows: , , or .

The characters to be printed on the second station. (Restrictions are the same as data1.) If this string is the empty string (""), then print the same data as data1. On some printers, by using this format may give additional increased print performance.

The characters to be printed on the first station. May consist of printable characters and escape sequences as listed in the topic. The characters must all fit on one printed line so that the printer may try to print on both stations concurrently.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerNotification
member.summary: Enumerates the possible states of power notification for the current device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerNotification.Disabled
member.summary: The service object will not provide power notifications to the application. No power notification events will be raised, and the property may not be set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerNotification.Enabled
member.summary: The service object will raise power notification events and update the property, beginning when the property is set to true. The level of functionality available depends on the value of the property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerReporting
member.summary: Enumerates the possible power reporting capabilities of a device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerReporting.Advanced
member.summary: The service object can determine and report all three power states, Off, Offline, and Online.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerReporting.None
member.summary: The service object cannot determine the state of the device. Therefore, no power reporting is possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerReporting.Standard
member.summary: The service object can determine and report two of the power states, OffOffline (that is, Off or Offline) and Online.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerSource
member.summary: Enumerates possible current power sources for a device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerSource.AC
member.summary: The current power source is the AC line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerSource.Backup
member.summary: The current power source is a backup source such as an UPS or backup battery.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerSource.Battery
member.summary: The current power source is a system battery. This value is only presented for systems that operate typically on battery.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerSource.NotAvailable
member.summary: Power source reporting is not available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerState
member.summary: Enumerates the possible current power state values for a device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerState.Off
member.summary: The device is turned off or detached from the terminal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerState.Offline
member.summary: The device is turned on but is either not ready or unable to respond to requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerState.OffOffline
member.summary: The device is either turned off or offline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerState.Online
member.summary: The device is turned on and ready for use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PowerState.Unknown
member.summary: Cannot determine the device's power state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeNotify
member.summary: Enumerates the possible cartridge-state notification capabilities for a printer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeNotify.Disabled
member.summary: Cartridge-state notifications are not available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeNotify.Enabled
member.summary: Cartridge-state notifications are available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeSensors
member.summary: Enumerates the possible printer-cartridge-monitoring sensors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeSensors.Cleaning
member.summary: A sensor that indicates the head is being cleaned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeSensors.Empty
member.summary: A sensor that indicates the cartridge is empty.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeSensors.NearEnd
member.summary: A sensor that determines whether the color cartridge is near its end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeSensors.None
member.summary: The device does not support cartridge-monitoring sensors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeSensors.Removed
member.summary: A sensor that indicates the cartridge has been removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeStates
member.summary: Enumerates the possible printer cartridge states.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeStates.Cleaning
member.summary: The printer head is being cleaned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeStates.Empty
member.summary: The cartridge is empty.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeStates.NearEnd
member.summary: The cartridge is near its end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeStates.OK
member.summary: The cartridge in normal condition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeStates.Removed
member.summary: The cartridge has been removed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterCartridgeStates.Unknown
member.summary: Cannot determine the cartridge state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors
member.summary: Enumerates the possible printer color cartridges.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Custom1
member.summary: Supports first custom color (Secondary color, usually red).

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Custom2
member.summary: Supports second custom color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Custom3
member.summary: Supports third custom color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Custom4
member.summary: Supports fourth custom color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Custom5
member.summary: Supports fifth custom color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Custom6
member.summary: Supports sixth custom color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Cyan
member.summary: Supports cyan color for full color printing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Full
member.summary: Supports full color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Magenta
member.summary: Supports magenta color for full color printing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.None
member.summary: Supports no color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Primary
member.summary: Supports primary color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterColors.Yellow
member.summary: Supports yellow color for full color printing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterErrorLevel
member.summary: Enumerates the possible severity levels for the most recent error condition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterErrorLevel.Fatal
member.summary: A nonrecoverable error has occurred. (For example, internal printer failure.)

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterErrorLevel.None
member.summary: No errors have occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterErrorLevel.Recoverable
member.summary: A recoverable error has occurred. (For example, out of paper.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterLogoLocation
member.summary: Enumerates the possible locations for setting a logo.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterLogoLocation.Bottom
member.summary: Puts the logo at the bottom of the document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterLogoLocation.Top
member.summary: Puts the logo at the top of the document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterMarkFeeds
member.summary: Enumerates the possible kinds of mark-sensed paper handling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterMarkFeeds.CurrentTopOfForm
member.summary: Feeds the mark-sensed paper to the present paper’s top of form. (Reverse feed if it is required).

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterMarkFeeds.Cutter
member.summary: Feeds the mark-sensed paper to the auto cutter cutting position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterMarkFeeds.NextTopOfForm
member.summary: Feeds the mark-sensed paper to the next paper’s top of form.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterMarkFeeds.None
member.summary: Does not feed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterMarkFeeds.Takeup
member.summary: Feeds the mark-sensed paper to the paper take-up position.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterSide
member.summary: Enumerates possible sides of the print station document on which printing can occur.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterSide.Opposite
member.summary: The opposite of the current side.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterSide.Side1
member.summary: Default print side.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterSide.Side2

Authorized key for reader that might be required for this operation; null if not applicable.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardInterfaceModes
member.summary: Lists the possible communication modes for Smart Card devices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardInterfaceModes.Apdu
member.summary: Same as Block mode except that the block of string data that contains commands and data sent to the SCR/W service object conforms to the ISO/IEC 7816 APDU (Application Protocol Data Units) standard for smart cards. ISO and EMV messaging formats are supported and selectable if the SCR/W has the capability to switch to one of these formats.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardInterfaceModes.Block
member.summary: A block of string data that contains commands and data is sent to the SCR/W device service object. The application and the SCR/W service object need to agree upon a communication protocol and data format before using this mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardInterfaceModes.Transaction
member.summary: Basic ASCII format for commands and data interchange.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardInterfaceModes.Xml
member.summary: A block of string data that contains commands and data is sent to the SCR/W service object. The application and the SCR/W service object agree to use a communication protocol and data format defined in this standard consistent with the XML Data Dictionary and XML schema guidelines as outlined in the NRF-ARTS IX Retail XML standard.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardIsoEmvModes
member.summary: Lists the valid message standards for a Smart Card device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardIsoEmvModes.Emv
member.summary: APDU messaging format conforms to the EMV standard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardIsoEmvModes.Iso
member.summary: APDU messaging format conforms to the ISO standard.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardReadAction
member.summary: Lists the possible types of processing of the data that is to be done by the smart card.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardReadAction.ExecuteAndReadData
member.summary: The data being read from the smart card present in the SCR/W is data that was processed by a program currently resident on the smart card. When this action is requested the smart card program is started and sends back the data that it has processed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardReadAction.ReadData
member.summary: The data being read from the smart card present in the SCR/W is from the data area on the smart card.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardReadAction.ReadProgram
member.summary: The data being read from the smart card present in the SCR/W is an executable program that was found in the smart card memory associated with executable programs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.SmartCardReadAction.XmlReadBlockData
member.summary: The data being read is XML data that the SCR/W is sending to the application. It is up to the application to parse the data being returned.

member.param: The number of milliseconds before failing the methodIf 0, the method initiates the begin removal mode and either returns immediately or raises an exception. If WaitForever, the method initiates the begin removal mode, then waits as long as needed until either the smart card is removed or an error occurs.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: E:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.ErrorEvent
member.summary: Raised by the Service Object to notify the application that an error has been detected at the device and a suitable response is necessary to process the error condition.

member.summary: Raised by the Service Object to notify the application that the queued output request has completed successfully.

member.summary: Indicates the number of tones sounded.

member.summary: Clears all buffered output data. This includes all asynchronous output.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.Sound(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sounds the indicator or starts it sounding asynchronously.
member.param: When numberOfCycles is not one, then pause for InterSoundWait milliseconds before repeating the tone cycle (before playing tone1 again).
If , then start the indicator sounding, and repeat continuously.Otherwise, perform the specified number of cycles.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.SoundImmediate
member.summary: Sounds the hardware tone generator one time, synchronously.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.AsyncMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value to indicate whether the method is performed asynchronously.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.CapPitch
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value to indicate whether the hardware tone generator can vary the tone pitch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.CapVolume
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value to indicate whether the hardware tone generator can vary the tone volume.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.InterToneWait
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds of silence between tone1 and tone2.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.IsExclusiveUseDevice
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether the is an exclusive-use device.
member.returns: A value of true indicates that the is an exclusive-use device. Otherwise, the value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.OutputId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the most recently started asynchronous output.

member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of the first tone in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.Tone1Pitch
member.summary: Gets or sets the pitch or frequency of the first tone in Hertz.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.Tone1Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets the volume of the first tone.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.Tone2Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of the second tone in milliseconds.

member.summary: Gets or sets the pitch or frequency of the second tone in Hertz.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PointOfService.ToneIndicator.Tone2Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets the volume of the second tone.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PointOfService.UpsChargeStates
member.summary: Lists the possible UPS charge states for a PosPower device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.UpsChargeStates.Critical
member.summary: UPS battery is in a critical state and can be disconnected at any time without further warning.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.UpsChargeStates.Full
member.summary: UPS battery is near full charge.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.UpsChargeStates.Low
member.summary: UPS battery is near zero charge. Application shutdown should be started to ensure that it can be completed before the battery charge is depleted. A minimum of two minutes of normal system operation can be assumed when this state is entered, unless this is the first charge state reported upon entering the "Off" power state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PointOfService.UpsChargeStates.Warning
member.summary: UPS battery is near 50% charge.
